intro: Pinalia ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's pincushion, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiky inflorescence that resembles a pincushion. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring and are pollinated primarily by bees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pinalia ledermannii is considered a vulnerable species.
